values: HELP!  I'm stuck at school with nothing to do, and I'm so bored that I'm updating my journal even though I have nothing to say.  Damn chemistry and its obstruction of my summer!
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/5622.html

Ok, I have a feeling this is going to be a long one.  We've got a lot of catching up to do.  

Friday night when Kathryn, Janette, and I went downtown for the fireworks was quite possibly one of the strangest evenings of my life.  We got off the RTA and Kathryn and Janette got some food from Taco Bell/KFC.  I guess Janette thought it would be fun to eat a taco even though she had just gotten her tonsils out the week before, and within one minute, she turned to the side and spit out a rather large pile of blood onto the ground.  I looked over at Kathryn, who started freaking out, Janette started to get really scared, and I felt it was time to go get a police officer.  I went and found one of those Mountie-looking officers in Tower City and told him what was going on.  He then went up to some guy in a suit and they started speaking some other language together really fast.  They called the EMS people, and I went back outside to help calm Janette (and Kathryn for that matter) while she filled up half a cup with blood.  It was really frightening to see her losing so much blood, but some crazy old policeman kept us laughing at the insane things he was saying to Janette.  He basically told her that her boyfriend was cheating on her, that her throat looked really bloody, and asked her if she was pregers or had HIV.  Talk about kicking someone when they're down, but for some reason it was really funny to all of us.  Janette wasn't bleeding too badly by the time the EMS crew got to us, because they took forever.  They were really nice, and they let us all pile into the ambulance, but they wouldn't drive over to the Clinic until they had all of Janette's info and it took forever.  The Deans actually got to the ER from Chagrin before we did from Tower City.  Unfortunately, the ER just brought a lot more waiting, and when the doctor removed the blood clot in her throat, she started to spit up a ton of blood again and had to get two IVs because of all the blood she lost.  She had to stay overnight for surgery to cauterize the area in her throat that was cut.  Thankfully, she is recovering now and is doing pretty well considering all she's been through.  Kathryn and I wanted to stay with her, but Mr.  Dean took us home around midnight or so.  The trip home was quite memorable if I do say so myself.  (I think Kathryn would agree.) 

To make up for such a stressful and scary night, yesterday was really great for the most part.  Kathryn and I went to the beach on the most perfect day imaginable.  There were no clouds, a light breeze to keep us from overheating, no bugs, plenty of pb&j and grapes, and a little bit of sunblock to prevent burning.  It was pretty relaxing, and I might of even got some sun.

Last night was absolutely fabulous.  Jeremy is the sweetest guy I've ever known.  I can't believe someone would go out of their way so often to make me feels so special.  I can't explain how adorable he is or how much I appreciate everything he does for me.  <blush>  Ok, I'm all sorts of giddy now, so I think I'm gonna go enjoy the feeling.
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/5175.html

Ah, it smells like a new month!  Summer is officially in full swing as the 4th is just around the corner.  In fact, Kathryn, Janette, and I are going downtown tonight for some festive fireworks and a little serenade by the Cleveland Orchestra.  I'm pretty excited about the whole adventure even though I just got back from downtown about an hour and a half ago.  I guess I can just never get enough of those crazy old RTA drivers.  

Speaking of my earlier Cleveland adventures today, I was down at CSU taking my final, and I have now successfully completed General Chemistry I in a 6 week period.  Now on to Gen. Chem. II for the next 6 weeks, followed by two weeks of freedom, and then back home to Denison.  Wow, strange how I consider Denison a home.  I'm not really sure how I feel about that one.

Anyway, last night I saw Spiderman 2 with Jeremy, his brother Jon, and his friend Steve.  Let me tell you, good times my friends.  Go see this movie, it's worth whatever outrageous price they charge you to see this on the big screen.  I think pretty much anyone would enjoy it.  The special effects are amazing, the story's exciting, there's love and romance, revenge, lots of fighting and destruction, a hot girl, a handsome guy, a crazy villain, and a Dashboard song to entertain you during the credits.  What more could you ask for???  Liz's rating-A
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/5074.html

Well kids, they're back in town.  My run of the house was fun while it lasted, but now it's back to the real world for me.  Before I accept this fate, however, let's take a look back at the week of freedom, shall we?

1 broken shower
6 cats
3 dogs
2 beta fish
3 burned fingers
last chem lab of the semester
last chem lecture of the semester
1 new roommate
6 massive muffins
1 out of town visit
30 cans of beer
1 bottle rum
1 bottle merlot
1 bottle plum wine
1/2 bottle of kahlua
8 drunken friends
2 amazing milkshakes
9 kitchen appliances
1 ass-long study session
lots of good food
6 mornings waking up to the best image I could ever want

=1 priceless week I am absolutely grateful for
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/4823.html

Ah, one more day until freedom.  That's right, as of 6pm tomorrow evening, I will have full range of my house and a car!  How refreshing.  Too bad I'm the only person I know of that doesn't get to go on a vacation...ever.  Oh well, at least it's a vacation from my parents, right?

Anyway, here's the week in review before the crazy weekend begins...
I woke up earlier than most farmers, went to school, played with chemicals, hung out with friends, studied, smiled a lot (carolyn knows why), and ate a bunch of food.  You know, the usual. 

Nick's graduation party was fun.  Kathryn and I ate some good Chag Town grub and congratulated Nick on finally graduating high school.  His mom made us take pictures in a cardboard cut out of a graduate in cap and gown.  It was funny.  I love Nick's mom.

I went fishing with Jeremy and Brian.  Jeremy caught a lake shark, but then it got caught in a tree and he lost it.  Yes, yes, it's sad but true.  But he caught a nice sized catfish right when we were about to leave, so he redeemed himself.  Brian and I didn't catch anything, but we did get to enjoy making fun of the hippie kids playing guitar and the nasty sewer lovers swimming in the lake.  All in all it was a good night if I do say so myself.

I just beat Jeremy at dnL online checkers!  WooHoo!!!  In all fairness he did beat me the game before this, but this game that I won took forever, so I feel pretty good about myself right now.  I can't really remember what else happened this week.  All the weeks sort of blend together in the summer, you know?  It's strange.  Oh well, I guess I'll leave it at that for now.
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/4490.html

Hey Kathryn, sorry about not saying happy birthday to you.  I haven't been updating my journal very well this week.  Better late than never, right?  So...

Happy 21st Birthday Kathryn!  Drink up!

Now that that's taken care of, we can continue.

The weirdest thing happened last night.  I was driving Jeremy back to his house and upon making a left turn, I simply didn't see exactly where to turn and almost past the street I was turning on.  Now everybody knows that I'm blind, but I've never had a problem like that before.  Granted, I don't see as well at night as I do in the day, but I've never had any major driving issues before, no tickets, no accidents, no big problems really.  It made me feel extremely embarrassed and frustrated.  Plus I think I scared the shit out of Jeremy, so I feel really bad about being so retarded.  I don't really know what happened, but I think I'm going to avoid having other people in my car at night as much as possible so that I keep the heart attacks to a minimum.

Anyway, I got to meet a few of Jeremy's friends, and they all seem really nice, pretty eccentric at times, but cool.  It's nice to be able to have a good time with people when you're just hanging out and not really doing much.  It's a sign of good company and quality people.  You can't ask for much better.

Today's looking like a pretty average Saturday.  I'm going to go drop off an application and pick up another one.  Then I'll probably mess around with my guitar and hopefully hang out with Becca for a while.  Finally, I think I'm ending the evening at Nicole's with the usual crowd.  Not the most exciting day in the world, but it may be fun.  I'll let you know.
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/4223.html
Yep, Carolyn's all grown up. *tear* Time to celebrate!
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/4090.html

Ok, so last night's party for Kathryn's birthday turned out quite differently from what I had imagined.  I was really excited about it and about fun times with some amazing people, but instead, everyone appeared to catch the plague.  Plus, I was pretty disappointed in myself for being somewhat inconsiderate to someone very special, and now I will have to work harder to start acting in ways that better express the way I'm feeling, because I know that the way I am feeling is important.

I've come to the conclusion that I shouldn't really question and analyze my feelings so much.  Sometimes you just have to go with them.  I can't feel guilty for moving on and being happy.  I think I am entitled to some happiness.  Therefore, I have officially cut the cord to the past and look ahead to bettering the present and future, because this is where I want to be.  I want to be here now, because this is where I feel comfortable, excited, and happy.  Where I am now feels like where I should be, so I'm moving forward and not looking back.
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/3613.html

Let's start things off right for June's first entry by traveling back in time to the 80s!
You're an Etch-a-Sketch!! You're the creative,
artsy type who doesn't need to actually utilize
a single muscle group in order to have fun.
Doesn't matter though, you're still cool.

What childhood toy from the 80s are you?
brought to you by Quizilla Ah, refreshing, isn't it? Anyway, today looks pretty nice outside so it's off to the Metros with Carolyn to go for a walk since she can't exercise too hard core after getting her wisdom teeth pulled yesterday. I'm excited to go back to the good old Metros. Unfortunately I need to start studying for my first chem exam, but the outdoors will make that a little more bearable than usual. Alright, time to shower and get this day going.
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/3379.html

I just got home from celebrating Memorial Day at my grandpa's house up in Kirtland Hills, and I am in such a good mood.  My aunt and uncle just adopted two little kids from Russia and they brought them over.  They are so adorable!  The little baby boy, Posha, is going to be 1 year old on June 12th and the little girl, Lera, is going to be 3 in October.  I couldn't stop smiling when they were around.  I love babies and little children.  It's once they start talking back and running around like crazy little people that I get annoyed with kids.  These two were absolutely wonderful.  Ah, children are so refreshing.

In other news, I'm thoroughly enjoying the company of my new friend.  I love meeting new people, especially ones like this who just seem to fit with me.  These are the best kind of strangers, the ones who make you feel like they knew you long before you actually met.

P.S.  June: you are the greatest.  I couldn't have dreamed of a better big.  Thank you for your call.  I love you dearly!
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/3132.html

How great is it when completely unexpected wonderful things happen to you.  It's quite fabulous.  I definitely approve of pleasant surprises, especially the most recent one in my life.  Sometimes it just takes one little person to totally change your mind about certain things, and I am grateful for that.
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/2869.html
sometimes people just need to learn to shut the fuck up
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/2809.html

I think that believing in fate is kind of like cracking open a crisp, golden fortune cookie.  It takes a lot of effort to find what you're looking for without chipping or breaking apart some of your surroundings/people in your life.  Then, once you discover what you've been searching after, you examine it, contemplate it for a bit, and it still makes no sense.  Apparently it's not supposed to make sense.

I don't know about my life lately.  It's all very odd.  The most unexpected things happen at the most random times, and these crazy things seem to occur more frequently the older I get.  I've felt a wide range of roller coaster emotions in the past few weeks, but I think keeping busy this summer is helping me wade through all of the fog inside of my head.  Taking summer classes at Cleveland State is quite possibly the best decision I could have made.  It keeps me from being lazy and wasting sunshine-filled days, it frees up my schedule senior year at Denison, I get to become best friends with all of the RTA operators, I have a lot of time and freedom to explore the city I was born in, it keeps my mind off of drama, and I get to hang out with some really amazing new people.  So far so good overall, I guess.  I just wish that some things could have happened differently.
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/2501.html

Last night I went to the new Grog Shop with Kathryn and Craig to see Sloan play a show.  I had never heard their music before, but it was alright.  There were some interesting people there, and Kathryn and I got hit on by a group of guys who tried to get me to make out with their supposedly gay friend.  I can't say I'd ever experienced this tactic before.  Maybe I just live a sheltered life.  But anyway, Craig stuck around forever talking to guys from every freaking band in Northeast Ohio so we didn't get back until 3-ish.  Then of course we fucked around for a while so I ended up crashing on Kathryn's couch around 5am.  Wow, I just realized that I've only slept in my own home twice since I got home from school for the summer.  Hmm, interesting...
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/2290.html

I'm stealing this phrase from Alaina, because it fits my life perfectly at the moment, and I have claimed it as my new motto.  That's right folks, single and poor in 2004.  

Hopefully I will soon find a job to change the poor part, although it's going to be hard since I'm taking a couple summer classes as well.  As for the single part, that's all a mystery that I will leave up to fate and coincidence.  All in all, life's not too bad I guess.  I mean, it sucks immensely, but I know it'll be alright in the end.  Thanks to all my friends, I have been nice and distracted.  Kathryn, Nick, and my other life savers at home have entertained me, and Ashley and all my sisters are the cutest, but I still don't think I'll make it down to Columbus tomorrow.  However, Ashley, I order you to have the biggeset 21st birthday in the history of 21st birthdays even though I will not be there to chant "Drink mother fucker.  Drink mother fucker.  Drink mother fucker.  Drink!"  

All in all life is just kinda weird right now, but it's still life, and I'm glad I'm living it, even if it's a bit shitty.

As for tonight, we will celebrate with Kathryn, Billy, and Katee over yonder in Kent.  Good times, good times...

I'm uber excited about my friend Miriam coming to visit tomorrow all the way from the 'Nati.  Although I've only been out of school for the summer for less than a week, I'm already starting to miss my friends back at Denison.  I know, it's pathetic, but it's hard to go from seeing people everyday to not seeing them at all for four months.  

Now the task has been assigned to me to make my good friend Miriam forget all about her ex-boyfriend turned jackass and show her a good time up here in Cleveland.  I have a few ideas of fun to be had, and hopefully I'll think of some more before she gets here.  So look out Northeast Ohio, we'll be out and on the prowl for some random acts of craziness!

As for tonight, I'm looking forward to some drinking and hanging out with old friends.  That's the best, being all nostalgic, catching up with each other's lives, and playing stupid games or talking out of your ass just in case you haven't made a big enough fool out of yourself in front of your friends over the years.  Ah, Kathryn, Katee, Nick-we're in for quite a ride tonight, I can feel it.
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/980.html

You know how there are some people in life that you know so well that you can tell how they are feeling, what they are thinking, and what they are about to say the moment they walk through the door?  Well I truly love that; a relationship, no matter what kind, can't get much better than that kind of closeness.  These might included family members for some, co-workers for others, but for me these people are my treasured friends, both at home and at school.  These are the people that I love the most and who are always there for me, often knowing me better than I know myself.

However, there are other people in my life that I can't seem to read so well.  There is this cloudy haze keeping some of my friends closed in and preventing the formation of this closeness.  This kink in connection can make me frustrated, ignorantly blissful, discouraged, or indifferent.  It all depends on the situation, but lately, I really wish I had a lie detector in my brain, so that I could break through the communication blockade that keeps me from completely understanding some people.  

Sometimes it's really hard to know who's side of the argument to believe, or if you're just being fed lines others think you want to hear, or what you should simply disregard immediately.  Maybe honesty is behind the words of these people, and their words should be accepted for what they are, but maybe it's deception that fuels the movement of their lips.  I hate that it's so hard to distinguish between what is false and what is true with these people.  It inhibits my ability to try and help them, be there for them, or improve our relationship, and it leaves me lost and confused with myself.  Why can't everyone just say what they are thinking and feeling instead of feel the need to make up some bull shit because they think it is the right thing to do.  The only right thing is the truth.
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/734.html

So I'm starting this journal due to a combination of signs all telling me that it is the right thing to do right now.  These signs include but are not limited to:

-I think I left my actual journal in Chicago, and I need a place to write down the crap floating around in my head.
-I was inspired by actually reading Dave's journal for once.
-I am obsessed with my computer and can't live without it.
-I can either do this or unpack all my stuff from school.
-I cried today, which is something I don't like to do very often, so I obviously need to get something out of my system.

And there you have it, now let the games begin!

Ok, first of all, I just got back from a road trip to Chicago where I got to spend some good old fashioned quality time with one of my best friends, Becca, her boyfriend Charlie, her roommates Jenny and Shawnie, and my road trip partner, Dave.  I think everyone can agree that we drank, we slept, and we conquered (and with minor injuries at that!)  Yeah, it was a fairly successful road trip, although the solo drive back to Cleveland was so boring I wanted to gouge my eyes out.  However, I made pretty good timing, so I decided against the gouging.  The entire trip was almost entirely drama free (minus a few things that I should have known better about), which unfortunately is not the case for the remainder of this entry. 

Have you ever noticed how as soon as things seem to begin making sense, something comes along and shakes it all up, leaving you face down in the snow like a poor, helpless group of carolers in a snow globe?  It's such bull shit.  I honestly believe that everything happens for a reason, but sometimes God enjoys challenging this belief a little too much.

I wonder, can you be in love with someone and still have feelings for someone else?  Is that allowed, or is it impossible?  How can you ever be sure that the love you feel is true love and nothing will ever compare?  

One of my close friends and her practically fiance just broke up, and I know beyond a shadow of a doubt that they were/are in love.  So then why are they faced with so much pain and disappointment right now?  I hate it.  It makes me feel sick, and I can't begin to understand it.  I guess I'm just not supposed to.
http://livesushi84.livejournal.com/472.html
